resources.string: • Check the local weather before you leave. • Avoid ridges, peaks, edges and clear areas if risk increases. • Identify areas of retreat in advance (cabana, building, dense forest not isolated). .

• Step away from others (about 10 m between people). • Bag/stick/metal objects away; Don't keep them on you. • Go down to a less exposed area, away from isolated trees and metal (closures). • Avoid shallow caves, metal shelters, edges and water (water courses, lakes). • Squat on the tip of your feet, arms around your knees, minimal contact on the ground. • Apply Rule 30/30: if lightning and thunder are spaced < 30 s, shelter; Wait 30 minutes after the last thunder. .
• Wait for the confirmed distance (≥30 min without thunder). • Checks the condition of the unit, warms/drys if necessary. • In case of accident, alert 112 and precise position, condition, access. .

• Leave early/late, avoid the hottest hours. • Wood small to small (0.5–1 L/h depending on effort), dirty a little food. • Cover yourself: hat/chap, glasses, sunscreen, light sleeves. • Weighs naked/forearm if possible, multiplies breaks in shade. • Warning signs: headache, nausea, cramps, dizziness, confusion — STOP, get shaded, refresh yourself, rehydrate yourself, warn if it persists. .

• Superimposed 3 layers (breathing / insulating / rainproof). • Warm head/hand/foot guard; changes a wet garment as soon as possible. • Cut the wind, shelter; move regularly without sweating excessively. • Drink and eat (hot if possible) to keep energy. • Warning signs: uncontrolled chills, awkwardness, drowsiness — warms gently, isolates soil/wind, alerts if worsening. .

• STOP: breathe, take stock. Don't sink at random. • Return to the last safe point (marking, crossing) if it is simple and short. • Card/boussole/GPS: check cap and level line; advances in short steps with markers. • At night/scratch, stay grouped, use whistle/lamp if necessary. • If long doubt or danger: shelter, save energy, alert if necessary. .

• Stay calm, widen the detour, keep your dog on a leash away from the beasts. • Do not cross a herd in its center, bypass while keeping the distance. • Close fences, don't scare animals, avoid running. • In front of a protective dog: stop, speak with a voice, slowly bypass. .
